content.description: This awesome boulder sit starts on positive holds down and right and climbs up and left to a blunt prow where there is a distinct crux. Paw your way up to better holds up high.
Stand start on a nice slopey hueco feature. Climb straight up on delicate holds, questing through a bit of lichen. Nice and techy.
content.location: Hike up the main Middle Elden trail, shortly after passing The Skeletor area there is an extremely slick slab to scramble up. This Large Boulder is directly above the slippery slab. Peabody slab climbs the west facing slab just left of center.

content.description: The obvious tall slab that sits in the basin above The Streaker and Tony’s Problem. Begin by compressing a right hand sloper/pinch and the left arête. Drop in to the large edge and pull onto the slab. Recoup and quest through thin terrain to the top of the boulder.
content.protection: 2-3 pads. Best not to biff it high on the slab.
content.location: Walk up the drainage past The Streaker and Tony’s Problem. Easy to see perched up on the right hillside.

content.description: Sit start on a low left hand pinch and right hand pocket, lunge up to some decent holds and figure out a way to mantle up on the slab.
content.location: From broken symmetry walk 20 feet to the west or "left"

content.description: Start on awesome huecos and make moves up the vertical face on incut edges to an easy top out. The landing is less than ideal.
content.location: Easily visible from the main trail as you walk up the canyon. This massive boulder sits on top of Broken Symmetry.

content.description: Large obvious pillar - begging to be climbed. Starts out funky, make your way to a good match-able edge  at the 12 foot mark, climb to the right onto the arete and finish on awesome moves on bullet rock.
content.location: From the main wash/trail walk approximately 200 feet to the west after passing Mesopotamia through a small patch of oak trees - right next to Black Sails.

content.description: One of the most aesthetic problems on the mountain, Broken Symmetry climbs a 30 degree overhang out an awesome blocky feature. Unfortunately with rotten stone near the top, this problem has broken several times since the first ascent. Recently it has been climbed with knee bar beta which allows skipping the now broken holds. Without having much luck on this problem myself, I estimated the grade based on conversations with others, please weigh in if you have experience on this problem.
content.protection: 3-4 Pads, landing is somewhat washed out.
content.location: Hike up the main canyon past Skeletor area and this boulder is pretty obvious right in the drainage.

content.description: Sit start on a good left hand undercling and right hand gaston crimp - difficult to pull on. Establish on crimps and make your way up the thin face. A great balancey test for technical climbers. The mantle is no gimme.
content.location: Follow the main trail past Mesopotamia. Cut up and left through a patch of oak trees to this flat area with a few nice problems.

content.description: Squat start on crimps, climb out to the arete and make a huge move from a jug to a sloping dish. Top out eases in difficulty.
content.location: As you hike up the canyon this is the right arete of the Broken Symmetry boulder.

content.description: This small area holds a few stand out classics. Broken Symmetry, put up by Tony Disanto in 2007 or so is one of the best in the higher grade range. It is a good hang and gets decent shade in the morning.
